Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.graph

Class Graph<K,V>

java.lang.Object
com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.graph.Graph<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the type of node keys used.
V - the type of node value contained.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Node<K,V>>
public final class Graph<K,V> extends Object implements Iterable<Node<K,V>>
General purpose graph data structure.

  • Method Details

    • add

      @NotNull public @NotNull Node<K,V> add(K key, V value)
      Adds a node to this graph containing the given data.
      Parameters:
      key - the new node's unique key.
      value - the value for the new node to contain.
      Returns:
      the new node.

    • remove

      public void remove(@NotNull K key)
      Removes a node from this graph.

      Note: this does not perform graph splitting. That must be done separately.

      Parameters:
      key - the key of the node to remove.

    • get

      @Nullable public @Nullable Node<K,V> get(@NotNull K key)
      Gets the node in this graph with the given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the node to get.
      Returns:
      the node with the given key.

    • split

      @NotNull public @NotNull List<Graph<K,V>> split()
      Splits all disconnected sets of nodes off into their own graphs.

      Note: this graph will always retain the largest body of nodes, returning the smaller bodies in the list.

      Returns:
      the new graphs made from the disconnected nodes.

    • join

      public void join(@NotNull @NotNull Graph<K,V> other)
      Joins this graph with another graph, moving all its nodes into this graph.
      Parameters:
      other - the other graph to join with.

    • link

      @Nullable public @Nullable Link<K,V> link(@NotNull K aKey, @NotNull K bKey)
      Links two nodes.
      Parameters:
      aKey - the key of the first node to link.
      bKey - the key of the second node to link.
      Returns:
      the link between the two nodes.

    • unlink

      @Nullable public @Nullable Link<K,V> unlink(@NotNull K aKey, @NotNull K bKey)
      Unlinks two nodes.

      Note: links are stored by opposite-node, so node order is not an issue.

      Parameters:
      aKey - the key of the first node to unlink.
      bKey - the key of the second node to unlink.
      Returns:
      the link that was just removed.

    • containsKey

      public boolean containsKey(@NotNull @CompatibleWith("K") @NotNull Object nodeKey)
      Checks to see if this graph contains the given node.
      Parameters:
      nodeKey - the key to check.
      Returns:
      whether this graph contains the given node.

    • containsKeys

      public boolean containsKeys(@NotNull @CompatibleWith("K") @NotNull Object... keys)
      Checks to see if this graph contains all the given nodes.
      Parameters:
      keys - the keys to check to see if this graph contains.
      Returns:
      whether this graph contains all the given nodes.
